results.title: The Blue Nile
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Kathrine Deng
results.brief_description: Through civil war Kathrine’s family are forced to change their lives, language and religion and eventually their country. Kathrine and her family are now living in Australia and they feel safe and have a chance to realise their dreams. Kathrine wants to make sure her children understand their cultural heritage and hopes that one day she can show them the Blue Nile.

results.title: The Blue mountains crossing - 1813
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Men of stamina”.
Takes the students from the original great journal of exploration by Blaxland, Wentworth and Lawson through to the present day development deriving from that exploration. No other credits available.

results.title: The Blue men of Morocco
results.brief_description: The strange story of a mysterious nomadic desert tribe of Arabs almost unknown to the outside world. The religious customs and strange ways of life of these people whose skin acquires its colour from the dye in their clothing. Explains how the tribe earns a living and describes a camel trip over the Sahara Desert and across the Atlas mountains to the city of Marrakesh. No other credits available.

results.title: The Blue lotus
results.creator_credit: Robert Rea, Stephane Bernasconi, Nelvana and Ellipse
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Adventures of Tintin”.
In the midst of a battle with smugglers, Tintin arrives in China, where he rescues a drowning Chang, a real-life friend of Herge who developed “The Adventures of Tintin”. Tintin must use all his courage, daring and intelligence to outsmart the traps of his enemies.

results.title: The Blue dog safety video
results.brief_description: Wally the dog is trained in home safety and his first assignment is to protect Junior, an adorable baby whose parents are safety-challenged. Accidents and near-accidents occur with lightning speed around their home, but Wally is always there to save the day. Over 40 important home safety tips are presented in a delightfully entertaining manner in this award winning Canadian program.

results.title: The Blue angel (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Erich Pommer, UFA and Josef von Sternberg
results.brief_description: The infatuation of a professor for a nightclub singer leads to his downfall. Sternberg reversed the meaning of Heinrich Mann’s novel “Professor Unrath” by making the professor a foolish, repressed victim rather than the corrupt and hypocritical exploiter of Lola portrayed in the novel. The film already shows Sternberg’s interest in visual density rather than narrative vigour, creating atmosphere rather than narrative tension, a preference for the maximum expressiveness of decor and lighting over surface realism. Stars Marlene Dietrich, Emil Jannings, Hans Albers and Kurt Gerron. Note: German dialogue, English subtitles.

results.title: The Blowfly
results.brief_description: This film depicts the life-cycle of one of the most common blowflies, the blue-bottle, calliphora erythrocephala. It is the big blue fly which everybody has seen settling on meat or occasionally buzzing about in the house.

results.title: The Blood of the beast = Le sang des betes
results.creator_credit: Paul Le Gros, Forces et Voix de la France and Georges Franju
results.brief_description: Classic documentary on a Paris slaughterhouse by Georges Franju which juxtaposes poetry and realism. Narrated by Jean Painleve and photographed by Marcel Fradetal. Music by Joseph Kosma. WARNING: Very graphic footage of animal slaughter.
